intro: Lappula cenchrusoides, commonly known as the slender lappula, is a flowering plant native to Eurasia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Lappula cenchrusoides is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
